column4: Microsoft market cap touches $1 trillion  pulls above Apple
column5: Microsoft Corp's market value vaulted above the $1 trillion mark for the first time in regular session trade on Thursday  pulling ahead of Apple Inc and making it the most valuable U.S. publicly traded company after quarterly earnings and revenue beat Wall Street expectations.

column4: US STOCKS-S&P 500 flat as losses in industrials offset gains in Facebook  Microsoft
column5: * Dow falls 0.48%  S&P up 0.04%  Nasdaq gains 0.25% (Updates to early afternoon)

column4: US STOCKS-Weak industrial earnings drag Wall Street lower
column5: * Indexes down: Dow 0.78%  S&P 0.18%  Nasdaq 0.01% (Changes comment  updates prices to late morning)

column4: GRAPHIC-Microsoft market cap touches $1 trillion  pulls above Apple
column5: April 25 Microsoft Corp's market value vaulted above the $1 trillion mark for the first time in regular session trade on Thursday  pulling ahead of Apple Inc and making it the most valuable U.S. publicly traded company after quarterly earnings and revenue beat Wall Street expectations.

column4: US STOCKS-3M slump keeps Wall St under pressure  tech offers support
column5: * Dow slides 0.80%  S&P off 0.09%  Nasdaq rises 0.45% (Updates to open)

column4: US STOCKS SNAPSHOT-Nasdaq hits record high at open on strong tech earnings; 3M weighs on Dow
column5: April 25 The tech-heavy Nasdaq index hit a fresh record at the open on Thursday after strong results from Facebook and Microsoft  while a slump in industrial conglomerate 3M weighed on the Dow and limited gains on the S&P.

column4: US STOCKS-Nasdaq eyes record high after strong tech earnings; 3M results hit Dow
column5: * Futures: Dow off 0.24%  S&P up 0.13%  Nasdaq rises 0.39% (Changes comment  updates price)

column4: Microsoft tops $1 trillion as it predicts more cloud growth
column5: Microsoft Corp on Wednesday briefly topped $1 trillion in value for the first time after executives predicted continued growth for its cloud computing business.

column4: UPDATE 5-Microsoft tops $1 trillion as it predicts more cloud growth
column5: April 24 Microsoft Corp on Wednesday briefly topped $1 trillion in value for the first time after executives predicted continued growth for its cloud computing business.

column4: New capital for Tesla will come at a cost
column5: A capital raise for Tesla Inc will not come cheap and  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk must finally prove to investors that he can produce and deliver Model 3s and higher margin electric cars on time  Wall Street analysts said on Thursday.

column4: New capital for Tesla will come at a cost
column5: April 25 A capital raise for Tesla Inc will not come cheap and  Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk must finally prove to investors that he can produce and deliver Model 3s and higher margin electric cars on time  Wall Street analysts said on Thursday.

column4: Panasonic may upgrade Japan plant to make advanced Tesla batteries: source
column5: TOKYO Panasonic Corp may upgrade one of its battery plants in Japan to produce advanced-format battery cells for Tesla Inc if needed by the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker  a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: Panasonic may upgrade Japan plant to make advanced Tesla batteries -source
column5: TOKYO  April 25 Panasonic Corp may upgrade one of its battery plants in Japan to produce advanced-format battery cells for Tesla Inc if needed by the U.S. electric vehicle (EV) maker  a person familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.

column4: Tesla's Musk 'sees merit' in capital raise  vows profit in third quarter after large loss
column5: Tesla Inc Chief Executive Elon Musk suggested on Wednesday a capital raise could be imminent  as the electric vehicle maker lost $700 million in the first quarter and predicted a return to profit in the third.

column4: Intel cuts full-year revenue forecast  misses on data-center sales
column5: Chipmaker Intel Corp cut its full-year revenue forecast on Thursday and missed analysts' estimates for first-quarter sales for its higher-margin data center business  sending its shares down 7 percent after hours.

column4: UPDATE 2-Intel cuts full-year revenue forecast  misses on data-center sales
column5: April 25 Chipmaker Intel Corp cut its full-year revenue forecast on Thursday and missed analysts' estimates for first-quarter sales for its higher-margin data center business  sending its shares down 7 percent after hours.

column4: Intel forecasts weak Q2  cuts full-year outlook
column5: April 25 Chipmaker Intel Corp forecast current-quarter revenue below analysts' estimates and cut full-year outlook on Thursday  sparking worries that an industry-wide slowdown could persist until the end of 2019  sending shares down 7 percent.
